title: Trump-Colombia tensions thaw after months of heated exchanges
subhed: After threatening and insulting Colombian leader Gustavo Petro, the US president unexpectedly invited him to the White House.

title: 'Nero at the Elysée': A story of hope dashed by Macron's presidency
Venezuela announces large-scale prisoner release
Israeli government accelerates settlement expansion in occupied West Bank
subhed: With tenders for 9,600 housing units for Jewish families in the occupied West Bank, 2025 set a record, with an openly stated goal of delivering 'a fatal blow to the idea of a Palestinian state.'

title: Iran protests swell nationwide as crackdown intensifies and internet is cut
subhed: The country saw the largest demonstrations in nearly two weeks, with rights groups reporting dozens of protesters killed.

title: France enjoys another banner year for tourism, buoyed by campgrounds and international visitors
subhed: International tourism revenue rose by 9% in France in 2025, according to the United Nations World Tourism Organization.

title: China's Pingtan Island reflects rising tensions in the Taiwan Strait
subhed: On Pingtan Island, China's closest point to Taiwan, repeated Chinese military maneuvers are exasperating fishers and fueling 'reunification' tourism.
byline: By Jordan Pouille (Pingtan Island (China), special correspondent)

title: Take Trump seriously on Greenland, Vance warns Europe
US strengthens grip on Venezuela by seizing two oil tankers, including one flying the Russian flag
byline: By Nicolas Chapuis (New York (United States) correspondent), Cécile Ducourtieux (London, correspondent) and Benjamin Quénelle

title: Macron says US is 'turning away' from allies

'If Doctors Without Borders were to cease activities in Gaza, the impact would be absolutely enormous'
subhed: In an interview with Le Monde, Filipe Ribeiro, head of mission for Doctors Without Borders in Jerusalem, responds to the Israeli government's decision to ban it and 36 other non-governmental organizations from operating in the occupied Palestinian territories.

title: French judges alarmed by rumors of US sanctioning magistrates who sentenced Le Pen
subhed: Peimane Ghaleh-Marzban, the president of the Paris judicial court, spoke out to condemn what he called 'unacceptable interference.' His remarks followed revelations in the German press about the possibility that the United States might sanction the French judges who sentenced Marine Le Pen.
byline: By Grégoire Biseau (Bordeaux) and Franck Johannès

title: Venezuela: How the US spent months preparing the military operation to capture Maduro
subhed: Images verified by Le Monde made it possible to reconstruct the US's vast military deployment at sea, on land and in the air in the months leading up to the abduction of the Venezuelan president.

title: Doctors' strike is a warning sign for French healthcare
The return of the US's predatory imperialism
Under Trump, the feats of the US military regularly run into the great void of the 'day after'
